1: <sup>1</sup> After these things the word of the LORD came unto Abram in a vision, saying, Fear not, Abram: I am thy shield, and thy exceeding great reward.
2: <sup>2</sup> And Abram said, LORD God, what wilt thou give me, seeing I go childless, and the steward of my house is this Eliezer of Damascus?
3: <sup>3</sup> And Abram said, Behold, to me thou hast given no seed: and, lo, one born in my house is mine heir.
4: <sup>4</sup> And, behold, the word of the LORD came unto him, saying, This shall not be thine heir; but he that shall come forth out of thine own bowels shall be thine heir.
5: <sup>5</sup> And he brought him forth abroad, and said, Look now toward heaven, and tell the stars, if thou be able to number them: and he said unto him, So shall thy seed be.
6: <sup>6</sup> And he believed in the LORD; and he counted it to him for righteousness.
7: <sup>7</sup> And he said unto him, I am the LORD that brought thee out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give thee this land to inherit it.
8: <sup>8</sup> And he said, LORD God, whereby shall I know that I shall inherit it?
9: <sup>9</sup> And he said unto him, Take me an heifer of three years old, and a she goat of three years old, and a ram of three years old, and a turtledove, and a young pigeon.
10: <sup>10</sup> And he took unto him all these, and divided them in the midst, and laid each piece one against another: but the birds divided he not.
11: <sup>11</sup> And when the fowls came down upon the carcases, Abram drove them away.
12: <sup>12</sup> And when the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell upon Abram; and, lo, an horror of great darkness fell upon him.
13: <sup>13</sup> And he said unto Abram, Know of a surety that thy seed shall be a stranger in a land that is not theirs, and shall serve them; and they shall afflict them four hundred years;
14: <sup>14</sup> And also that nation, whom they shall serve, will I judge: and afterward shall they come out with great substance.
15: <sup>15</sup> And thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace; thou shalt be buried in a good old age.
16: <sup>16</sup> But in the fourth generation they shall come hither again: for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet full.
17: <sup>17</sup> And it came to pass, that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold a smoking furnace, and a burning lamp that passed between those pieces.
18: <sup>18</sup> In the same day the LORD made a covenant with Abram, saying, Unto thy seed have I given this land, from the river of Egypt unto the great river, the river Euphrates:
19: <sup>19</sup> The Kenites, and the Kenizzites, and the Kadmonites,
20: <sup>20</sup> And the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Rephaims,
21: <sup>21</sup> And the Amorites, and the Canaanites, and the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.
